newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss shares end up but below highs.
newsitem.headline: Swiss shares end up but below highs.

text.p: 1430 GMT - Swiss shares ended above Monday's close, but fell back from the day's highs after a weaker Wall Street opening, dealers said.
A weaker tendency in the Swiss franc was helpful to industrials while financials were mostly lower, a trader noted. Actively-traded Roche certificates added 60 francs to 9,190.
* Blue-chip Swiss Market Index (SMI) advanced 9.8 points, or 0.27 percent, to to 3,694.2 points.
* Broad Swiss Performance Index (SPI) up 6.24 points, or 0.26 percent, to 2,366.90.
Sentiment was described as good after investors seemed to have resigned themselves to the possibility of an interest rate hike in the U.S.
* Among major insurers, which had gained around two percent on Monday, Swiss Re and Zurich were weaker. Swiss Re fell 12 francs to 1,313. Winterthur added five francs to 754.
* UBS gave up five francs to 1,177.
* Nestle rose 10 francs to 1,423 amid some foreign buying ahead of the release of Nestle's half-year profit figures, expected on Friday.
* CS Holding added 0.25 francs to 124. Dealers said there were rumours that CS may make an offer for Austria's Creditanstalt Bankverein.
Other traders thought an offer unlikely as CS Holding was busy implementing a major restructuring project announced earlier this year.
* Among second-tier shares, Valora recovered from recent losses. Adecco, Jungfaubahn Holding and Globus posted gains.
* Suedelektra was lower after Monday's half-year report.
